page.title: 08A family's Sunday
page.content: On Sunday,October 20th,1985,the Jones family,Gary,Liz,and their children, Rowan and Rachel,arranged to meet friends at Craig-y-nos in the Tawe Valley at 9-30am.Gary and Liz are keen on outdoor pursuits.The friends arrived and the party set off and walked to Llyn-y-fan fawr.They then climbed Fan Hir rising to a point 720 metres above sea level.The party returned to the South Wales Caving Club for a cup of tea and a chat with some of the speliologists.Gary and Liz live in Llanyre.Their children are receiving bi-lingual education.The family moved from Wiltshire in 1980 because Gary,a social worker wanted to return to Wales.He applied for and got a job in Social Services in Powys County Council with more pay and responsibility.
